skill.name: nextjs-app-router-patterns
skill.description: Master Next.js 14+ App Router with Server Components, streaming, parallel routes, and advanced data fetching. Use when building Next.js applications, implementing SSR/SSG, or optimizing React Server Components.
skill.summary: Master Next.js 14+ App Router with Server Components, streaming, parallel routes, and advanced data ...

security_audit.summary: Scanned the skill content and found only documentation and example code. No credential access, exfiltration, obfuscation, or malicious execution patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Building App Router apps can be confusing with many routing and data options. This skill provides clear patterns and examples for Next.js 14+ features.
actual_capabilities: Explain when to use Server Components versus Client Components
Provide App Router file conventions for layouts and routes
Show Server Actions patterns for mutations and redirects
Detail parallel and intercepting routes with examples
Outline caching, revalidation, and metadata strategies
limitations: Does not run code or access your project files
Examples use placeholder APIs and databases
Does not cover Pages Router specific patterns
No automated migration scripts are provided

use_cases.title: Start an App Router project
use_cases.description: Get a structured template for layouts, loading states, and data fetching.

use_cases.title: Design routing architecture
use_cases.description: Plan parallel and intercepting routes for complex dashboards.

use_cases.title: Optimize data fetching
use_cases.description: Choose caching and revalidation strategies for product pages.

prompt_templates.title: App Router basics
prompt_templates.scenario: You are new to App Router
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the core App Router file conventions and when to use Server Components versus Client Components.

prompt_templates.title: Add Server Actions
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Server Actions pattern for adding an item to a cart with revalidation and redirect.

prompt_templates.title: Parallel routes plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a parallel routes structure with loading states for analytics and team panels.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced caching
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend caching and revalidation choices for product listings and detail pages with tag invalidation.

output_examples.input: How should I structure an App Router product page with streaming and caching
output: Use a server component for the product header so it renders first
Wrap slow sections like reviews in Suspense with loading UI
Use revalidate tags on product fetches for controlled cache refresh

best_practices: Start with Server Components and add client only when needed
Colocate data fetching with the component that uses it
Use Suspense boundaries to enable streaming and clear loading states
anti_patterns: Fetching critical data in Client Components without a server fallback
Over nesting layouts that inflate render trees
Skipping loading states for slow data sources

faq.question: Is this compatible with Next.js 14 and 15
faq.answer: Yes, it targets Next.js 14+ App Router patterns that remain compatible with Next.js 15.

faq.question: What limits should I expect
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples, but it does not generate full project code or run builds.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing app
faq.answer: Yes, you can apply the patterns to your current App Router structure incrementally.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files
faq.answer: No, it only provides guidance and examples without accessing local files.

faq.question: What if a pattern does not fit my case
faq.answer: Describe your constraints and request a tailored variation of the pattern.

faq.question: How does this compare to official docs
faq.answer: It summarizes and organizes patterns with practical examples, while the docs are the primary reference.
